discussion.content: configure ACI, migrate L2 first, L3 gateway later on, we want to make sure all the fuss regarding physical L1/L2 work is completed successfully first before touching Layer 3, decomission last

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
An engineer must migrate servers from a legacy data center infrastructure to a Cisco ACI fabric. Drag and drop the steps from the left into the order that they must be completed on the right to ensure the least amount of downtime.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.A: Cisco ACI spines perform ingress replication for STP BPDUs
choices.C: BPDUs are forwarded over IPN using the bridge domain GIPo multicast address
choices.D: Special multicast group 239.255.255.255 is used to forward STP BPDUs
choices.B: Cisco ACI spines suppress STP BPDUs to be forwarded to other pods

questions.question_text: How does Cisco ACI manage the STP BPDUs between two pods?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. BPDUs are forwarded over IPN using the bridge domain GIPo multicast address

questions.question_text: Which action must be taken to connect two nonsilient servers in active/standby mode to two ACI leaves?

discussion.content:
B / ARP Flooding : ....With clustered servers or HA pairs of firewalls and load balancers, you need to configure ACI to flood Gratuitous ARP in a bridge domain, because after a failover, the same IP address may be using a different MAC address.In these scenarios, Gratuitous ARP (GARP) is used to update host ARP caches or router ARP caches, so in this case you should select the ARP flooding option in the bridge domain. 
FROM https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/whitepapers/cisco-application-centric-infrastructure-design-guide.html

choices.D: Disable dataplane learning to avoid endpoint flapping
choices.C: Configure ARP flooding for the bridge domain if the MAC address of the active interface stays identical after a NIC failover
choices.B: Enable ARP flooding for the bridge domain if the MAC address of the active interface changes after NIC failover
choices.A: Implement a virtual PortChannel on ACI leaves

questions.question_text: What is the outer destination IP address in the VXLAN encapsulated packet for Layer 2 Broadcast, Unknown-unicast and Multicast (BUM) that is sent between two Cisco ACI sites?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Overlay Multicast TEP

O-MTEP is a destination IP for BUM traffic between sites

Selected Answer: A
A. Enable the Shared between VRFs option for the BD subnet in the production VRF.

classic subnet is related to BD component
By enabling this option we allow for production VRF to route leak IP prefixes to other vrf

choices.A: Enable the Shared between VRFs option for the BD subnet in the production VRF.
choices.D: Export the contract from provider to consumer tenant.
choices.B: Change the contract scope to Global.
choices.C: Enable the Shared between VRFs option for the EPG subnet in the non-production VRF.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An administrator configures inter-VRF route leaking between Production:vrf-prod and Non-Production:vrf-nonprod. However, the route in the Non-Production:vrf-nonprod VRF to the production tenant is missing. Which action resolves the VRF route leaking issue?
